articles.title: Heavy Rain Hits Rason City of DPRK
articles.content:
Heavy Rain Hits Rason City of DPRK
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Recent downpour hit a northern border city of Rason in the DPRK, causing big damage.
					 The city witnessed rainfall of 250 millimeters from around 04:00 Saturday to about 22:00 Sunday. In particular, 155 mm of rainfall was observed between 16:00 and 19:00 Saturday.
					
					 The heavy rain left 5 240 dwelling houses, 99 public service buildings and 51 railway sections including a bridge destroyed and 125 hectares of farmland inundated.
					
					 All its citizens have turned out in a campaign to heal the flood damage while offering relief goods to the victims.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Croatian Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Croatian Ambassador
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Nebojsa Koharovic, Croatian ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of International Symposium-2015
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of International Symposium-2015
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The participants of the International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University presented a letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un Wednesday.
					 The letter said the symposium on the theme of "Scientific development and building of highly civilized nation" was a meaningful gathering that offered an opportunity of furthering exchanges, friendship and cooperation between foreign universities and Kim Il Sung University with a view to enhancing the pioneer role of science and actively contributing to the building of a highly civilized country.
					
					 The symposium helped see the resourceful Korean people building a highly civilized socialist country by dint of modern science and technology under the outstanding guidance of His Excellency Kim Jong Un, the letter said, adding this convinced them of the bright future of the DPRK.
					
					 All the scholars who took part in the symposium shared an understanding that active exchanges with Kim Il Sung University with huge academic potential would be beneficial to developing human science and building a highly civilized society, the letter noted.
					
					 The letter reiterated the will to make efforts to develop multi-faceted exchanges and cooperation with Kim Il Sung University on the basis of the achievements and experience gained during the symposium.

articles.title: Panel Discussions Held at International Symposium-2015
articles.content:
Panel Discussions Held at International Symposium-2015
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- There were panel discussions at the International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 They included mathematics and medical, life and agricultural sciences.
					
					 They were attended by teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University and prestigious scholars from universities and scientific research institutions of various countries.
					
					 Papers were presented at the panel discussions.

articles.title: International Symposium-2015 Closes
articles.content:
International Symposium-2015 Closes
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The International Symposium-2015 of Kim Il Sung University was closed with due ceremony at the university on Wednesday.
					 It offered teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University and prestigious scientists of various universities and research institutions of the world a meaningful occasion of exchanging research successes of academic value in fields of mathematics and medical, life and agricultural sciences. 
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, teachers and researchers of the university and the participants in the symposium.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.
					
					 Ri Kuk Chol, vice-president of the university, made a closing speech.

articles.title: E-book "My Companion 2.0"
articles.content:
E-book "My Companion 2.0"
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- E-book "My Companion 2.0" was developed by the Samhung IT Exchange Company in the DPRK.
					 The program, which can be installed at mobile phone and tablet computer, consists of more than 600 publications, ranging from socio-political to cookery and science and technology books.
					
					 Its developer Ryu Jong Hak told KCNA that it is in great demand from among the people.
					
					 Rim Chun Wol, a citizen living in Tongdaewon District, Pyongyang, said it greatly helps readers deepen their knowledge and common sense.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Boost Production of Processed Laver
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Boost Production of Processed Laver
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of Fisheries concentrates efforts on raising the output of laver and its processed products, true to the intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to supply nutritious laver to the citizens on a normal basis.
					 Practical measures were taken to create several hundred hectares of laver nursery in the west sea of the country and establish a new method of cultivating laver.
					
					 Meanwhile, the ministry is striving to update the laver processing factories and build another factory with a large capacity at the Pupho Offshore Farm.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Vietnamese Ministry of Public Security led by Nguyen Kim Quy, vice director general of the General Bureau of Security, and other foreigners visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 At the halls where the great leaders lie in state, they made bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Reckless Moves to Turn Country into Military Giant under Fire
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Reckless Moves to Turn Country into Military Giant under Fire
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have become zealous in their arms buildup, says Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary.
					 The Japan Defense Ministry recently applied for about five trillion yen as defense spending for 2016 and the government is now discussing it with relevant institutions, according to foreign press reports.
					
					 Sources available say that lots of fund will be spent for improving arms equipment such as the purchase of armored cars for the Ground "Self-Defense Force" and the maritime "Self-Defense Force" out of defense expenditure for 2016, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The biggest-ever defense budget in history proves that the Japanese reactionaries have reached ever more reckless phase in their moves for becoming a military giant and realizing militarist expansion overseas.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have long pushed forward the design of becoming a military giant, viewing it as a material foundation for realizing their militarist ambition for overseas aggression.
					
					 Today the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" have grown to be offensive forces as powerful as world's top level forces in terms of weaponry.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. is fanning up Japan's militarization moves.
					
					 Citing the revision of the U.S.-Japan defense cooperation guidelines as a pretext, the Japanese reactionaries are putting spurs to the militarization. This reckless war hysteria gravely threatens peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should clearly understand that war will never bring Japan bright future.

articles.title: Teaching Staff and Students of Japanese Universities Oppose Security Bills
articles.content:
Teaching Staff and Students of Japanese Universities Oppose Security Bills
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Opposition to the authorities' push for security bills is mounting among teaching staff and students of Japanese universities, according to Yonhap News of south Korea on August 23.
					 Nagoya University formed an organization opposing the bills on August 5 comprising about persons 150 including renowned professors.
					
					 Supporters reached 420.
					
					 Kyoto University arranged a meeting opposing the bills sponsored by its teaching staff last month, eliciting support of some 2 200.
					
					 Universities that voiced opposition to the security bills numbered approximately 90 as of August 22.
					
					 Professors and students are setting up new homepages, expanding activities against the bills.
					
					 A professor of Doshisha University affiliated to the Society of Scholars against Security Bills decried the bills, saying they can scrap the constitution. He clarified students and scholars are raising their voices critical of the bills because they felt that democracy in Japan is getting questionable.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Efforts for Development of NAM
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Efforts for Development of NAM
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- 40 years have passed since the DPRK became a member nation of the Non-aligned Movement (NAM). 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday devotes an article to this day.
					
					 The DPRK has made positive efforts for the development and victorious advance of the NAM for the past four decades as its dignified and prestigious member nation, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 Thanks to the positive activities of the DPRK government, the NAM could develop true to its noble ideal and purpose despite all difficulties. 
					
					 It has made a lot of successes, strengthening unity and solidarity among its member nations and intensifying joint actions in the international arena. 
					
					 The present international situation urgently requires the NAM to be more faithful to its mission and ideal and increase its might and role. 
					
					 The imperialists have gone to extremes in their moves to divide and destabilize the anti-imperialist, independent countries.
					
					 If these countries fail to struggle in unity, they can neither be free from the yoke of the imperialists forcing dependence and subjugation on them nor defend peace and security of the world. 
					
					 The DPRK is making utmost efforts to defend regional peace and advance the cause of global independence even under the situation where the U.S. and its followers intensify their moves to isolate and stifle the former as never before and the danger of a nuclear war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The NAM should fully exercise its influence on the actions to foil the U.S. and its followers' undisguised moves for aggression and unjust sanctions, a stumbling block lying in the way of settling the issue of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The DPRK will as ever work hard to develop the NAM and build an independent new world.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Moves to Ignite New War
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Moves to Ignite New War
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Department of State recently approved the plan of the Lockheed Martin to sell the Aegis combat system and a set of the latest facilities for detecting submarines to Japan. 
					 Shortly ago, it also approved the sale of arms equipment worth 2.5 billion U.S. dollars to south Korea under the signboard of the "project for improving the performance of fighters".
					
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. is mulling deploying for the first time F-35B in a unit of the U.S. Marines to be transferred to the base in Iwakuni, Japan in 2017 and transferring 4 global hawks to the Misawa U.S. military base in Aomori Prefecture, Japan from Guam. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said U.S. moves are aimed to turn the vicinity of the Korean Peninsula into an advance base for rounding off its worldwide missile defence system and forward-deploy the latest weapons needed for igniting a new war in a bid to escalate its military pressure and threat to the DPRK.
					
					 Keen on confrontation and war, the U.S. is making desperate efforts to save its hostile policy toward the DPRK from total failure, far from drawing a serious lesson from it.
					
					 Aware that there is no chance of victory in the ideological and moral confrontation with the DPRK, the U.S. is making a foolish bid to bring the former to its knees by pressurizing it through military and technical advantages.
					
					 It seeks to ignite the second Korean war the moment it is sure that it has upper hand of muscle.
					
					 The situation goes to clearly prove that the U.S. delivery of the latest military hardware to its war servants and its beef up of forces in the vicinity of the peninsula would only escalate the tension on the peninsula and put the regional peace and security at greater peril.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities Decried for Shunning People's Demand
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities Decried for Shunning People's Demand
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The laid-off workers of Ssangryong Motors, inhabitants of Kangjong Village on Jeju Island and the bereaved family members of victims of the disaster in Ryongsan and ferry Sewol sinking held a press conference on Jeju Island on August 23 in denunciation of the unpopular rule of the puppet authorities.
					 Speakers said broad segments of people turned out in the struggle because of the present regime's violence and greed of capital.
					
					 They accused the authorities of snubbing those who were deprived of their right to existence and peace and who lost their beloved children and parents.
					
					 They vowed to fight it out until their demands are met.

articles.title: Juvenile Crimes on Increase in S. Korea
articles.content:
Juvenile Crimes on Increase in S. Korea
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Crimes have become endemic among south Korean teenagers, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Newsis on August 23.
					 The number of teenagers who had been put in custody on charges of murder, theft, rape, arson and other high profile crimes reached more than 13 000 from 2011 to 2014.
					
					 Rape and other sex-related crimes held 70 percent of them.
					
					 Murder has been on steady increase and as a result 2.8 times more murder cases than that in the year 2011 were reported last year.

articles.title: DPRK's Tremendous Might Lauded by German Organization
articles.content:
DPRK's Tremendous Might Lauded by German Organization
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany issued a statement on Aug. 17 denouncing the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet warmongers for their reckless provocations.
					 The statement urged the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces and other allied forces to stop the acts against the peace-loving DPRK at once.
					
					 In the DPRK genuine human rights are being guaranteed under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The U.S. interference in the DPRK's internal affairs under the pretext of "human rights" is absolutely unjustifiable.
					
					 The DPRK having powerful nuclear deterrent will bolster up its defence capability and certainly achieve the prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 Now the U.S. and its stooges should recognize the fact that they can never bring down the DPRK through ridiculous sanctions and blockade.
					
					 No foreign force can provoke the DPRK which is equipped with nuclear deterrent and achieved the perfect unity of the leader, the party and masses.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Korea's Liberation Praised
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign political party and organizations posted on their internet websites special write-ups illustrated  with photos of President Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation in an article praised the President for achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation and founding the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East. 
					
					 The South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in an article captioned "Kim Il Sung, benefactor of Korea's liberation " said that the Korean people actively turned out in the sacred struggle for the liberation of the country, holding him in high esteem as the sun of the nation. Under his leadership the Korean people greeted the historical day of Korea's liberation, the article added. 
					
					 The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK in an article said that the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by the President was a legendary guerrilla struggle unprecedented in the world history. The President's legendary guerrilla struggle was well known to the world at that time, the article said, adding: His great personality as a legendary guerrilla commander will go down in history.

articles.title: Anniversary of Founding of WPK to Be Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Founding of WPK to Be Celebrated in Russia
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated in Nakhodka, Russia on Aug. 22.
					 Zelenov, first secretary of the Nakhodka City Committee of the Maritime Territory of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events for praising the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried articles to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya on Aug. 13 in an article said President Kim Il Sung embarked on the road of the revolution in his early years with the great intention to save the destiny of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The Kuwaiti paper Kuwait Times on Aug. 16 carried an article captioned "On August 15, the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule." 
					
					 The article said "Song of General Kim Il Sung", immortal revolutionary hymn sung in liberated Korea, is still reverberating far and wide, powerfully encouraging the Korean people in their drive to build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The Algerian paper Saut Al Ahrar on Aug. 15 carried an article illustrated with a photo showing a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang City. 
					
					 It said that the independence of Korea was the precious fruition made by the Korean revolutionaries through a 15-year-long anti-Japanese armed struggle under the leadership of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 The paper introduced the DPRK, saying that its appearance has dramatically changed thanks to the great heyday in construction.

articles.title: Just Cause of Korean People Supported by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Just Cause of Korean People Supported by Foreign Figures
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in foreign countries from Aug. 10 to 17 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 They included meetings of the German Communist Party and the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, a Korean cultural exhibition in Harbin City, Heilongjiang Province in China and a film show at a female and children hospital in Zamfara State of Nigeria.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Displayed there were their famous works, and books, photos and art pieces introducing the DPRK achieving prosperity by dint of Songun.
					
					 The chairman of the German Communist Party praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a genuine socialist state in which the people became masters of everything and everything serves them and the paradise for the people to be envied by the world people.
					
					 The chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and other speakers said that the DPRK could win only victories without any vacillation in any adversity thanks to the wise guidance of the great leaders, adding that the DPRK serves as a banner of struggle for the progressive people advocating independence.
					
					 They extended full support to the Korean people in their just cause of accelerating the building of an economic power while demonstrating the might of the politico-ideological and military power under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The participants of the film show watched the Korean film "Pyongyang, Venue of Festival".

articles.title: Danos por inundaciones en ciudad de Rason
articles.content:
Danos por inundaciones en ciudad de Rason 
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- La ciudad de Rason sufrio grandes danos por inundaciones. 
					Desde las 4:00 del dia 22 hasta las 22:00 del 23 cayeron alli mas de 250mm de lluvia. 
					
					En particular, de las 16:00 a las 19:00 del dia 22 se registraron 155 mm de precipitaciones.
					
					Se damnificaron 5 mil 240 viviendas de mas de mil 70 edificios. Fueron destruidos 99 edificios publicos inclusive los organismos, empresas, escuelas, casas-cunas, jardines de la infancia, hospitales y policlinicas y 51 puntos de ferrovias y se anegaron 125 hectareas de tierra cultivable. 
					
					La ciudad concentra todas las fuerzas en la recuperacion de los danos suministrando a los damnificados gran cantidad de alimentos, combustibles y otros materiales necesarios.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador croata
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador croata
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- Nebojsa Koharovic presento este miercoles en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, las cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica de Croacia en la RPDC.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Debates por secciones de Simposio Academico Internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Debates por secciones de Simposio Academico Internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar los dias 25 y 26 los debates por secciones del Simposio Academico Internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung en este plantel docente.
					Los debates se realizaron divididos en las secciones de matematicas, medicina, ciencia de vida y agronomia.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los profesores e investigadores de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y los sabios  prestigiosos de las universidades y los organos de investigacion cientifica de varios paises.
					
					En las ocasiones se presentaron varias disertaciones.
					
					Los oradores explicaron profundamente los problemas academicos en sus disertaciones.

articles.title: Programa de lectura de libros "Mi amigo 2.0"
articles.content:
Programa de lectura de libros "Mi amigo 2.0"
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- El programa de lectura de libros "Mi amigo 2.0" recien desarrollado por el centro de intercambio de IT de Samhung de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea gana mucha popularidad de los trabajadores.
					El programa consta de partes de los libros socio-politicos, los libros socioculturales, la literatura coreana, la literatura mundial, los libros docentes, los medicos, los infantiles y los cientificos y tecnicos. Los moviles y computadoras de tableta lo pueden instalar en sus sistemas.
					
					El programa contiene mas de 600 libros electronicos editados en los ultimos anos como "Conocimientos del gran hombre", "Balance de sangre inacabado", la novela larga "Confesion de sabia", "Taegyedo", los libros de plato casero, los conocimientos de deportes, los libros que ayudan a mejorar el poder de la imaginacion, observacion, pensamiento y memoria inclusive "Contesta rapidamente" y "?Quien sabe mucho?" y otros que despiertan el interes de los lectores.
					
					El desarrollador del programa Ryu Jong Hak, empleado del centro de intercambio de IT de Samhung, menciono que el programa acapara a los usuarios por su comodidad y rapidez.
					
					Rim Chun Wol, moradora del capitalino municipio Tongdaewon dijo que antes pudo obtener los libros solo en la libreria o biblioteca pero con este programa puede leer los libros de variados tipos, asi que se convierte en su amigo intimo que ensena muchos conocimientos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun se refiere a esfuerzos de RPDC por desarrollo de MNOAL
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun se refiere a esfuerzos de RPDC por desarrollo de MNOAL
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 40o aniversario del ingreso de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como pais miembro del Movimiento de los Paises No Alineados (MNOAL), el diario Rodong Sinmun publico este miercoles un articulo individual .
					A lo largo de los 40 anos, la RPDC ha venido esforzandose por el desarrollo y el avance victorioso del MNOAL, gracias a lo cual este movimiento se ha desarrollado conforme a su noble ideal y meta superando todas las dificultades y pruebas, senala el documento y prosigue:
					
					El Movimiento ha alcanzado muchos exitos mediante la solidaridad entre los paises miembros y sus acciones conjuntas en la palestra internacional. 
					
					La situacion internacional de hoy demanda apremiantemente que el MNOAL sea mas fiel a su mision e ideal y fortalezca su poderio y papel. 
					
					Ha llegado a la extremidad la campana de los imperialistas para desintegrar a los paises independientes y antiimperialistas. 
					
					Si los paises independientes y antiimperialistas no juntan sus fuerzas, no podran liberarse nunca de la dominacion y subyugacion de los imperialistas ni defender la paz y la seguridad del mundo. 
					
					Se tornan cada dia mas siniestras las maniobras de EE.UU. y sus satelites tendentes a aislar y asfixiar a la RPDC, pero esta hace todo lo posible por preservar la paz de la region y llevar adelante la causa por la verificacion de la independencia en el mudo entero.
					
					El MNOAL ha de ejercer suficientemente su influencia en acabar con las abiertas maniobras de agresion y las injustas sanciones de EE.UU. y sus satelites que impiden la resolucion del problema de la Peninsula Coreana. 
					
					En adelante tambien la RPDC se esforzara por el desarrollo del MNOAL y la construccion de un nuevo mundo independiente.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia intencion de aumento de gastos militares de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia intencion de aumento de gastos militares de Japon
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual divulgado el dia 26, el periodico Minju Joson revela la intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses de aumentar considerablemente los gastos militares como sigue:
					Segun fuentes extranjeras, hace poco el Ministerio de Defensa de Japon solicito casi 5 billones de ￥ como gastos para la defensa nacional de 2016 y el gobierno esta consultando con los organos interesados por el respecto.
					
					Las fuentes transmiten que la mayoria de los gastos para la defensa nacional de 2016 se destinara al mejoramiento de los armamentos inclusive la compra de carros blindados para las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa" y buques de guerra para las "Fuerzas Navales de Autodefensa".
					
					El hecho demuestra que esta en la etapa crucial la intencion de los reaccionarios japoneses de convertir su pais en una potencia militar y realizar su ambicion de agresion al ultramar.
					
					Desde hace mucho tiempo, los reaccionarios islenos han venido impulsando la conversion de su pais en la potencia militar, considerandola como una base material para realizar su ambicion militarista de expansion a ultramar
					
					Hoy dia, las fuerzas armadas de "autodefensa" de Japon se han convertido en las fuerzas de ataque de talla mundial.
					
					Lo que no puede pasar por alto es que Estados Unidos incita activamente tales maniobras de Japon.
					
					Se ven muy amenazadas la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste  Asiatico debido a la imprudente locura belica de los reaccionarios japoneses que dan espuela a la realizacion de la potencia militar bajo el pretexto de la enmienda de la guia de cooperacion en defensa EE.UU.-Japon.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben saber claramente que la guerra no les dara nunca el radiante futuro.
